events.description:
â€¢ DevFest events cover multiple product areas such as Android, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, Machine Learning, and Mobile Web...

â€¢ Technical topics will be selected based on the needs of Developer community. Moreover, DevFest 2017 is aim to enhance relevant soft skills for Developers to advance their career.

â€¢ GDG DevFest 2017 is open for all IT communities, developers, experts, geeks, or students, who want to participate in this dev festival with us!

events.name: Droidcon Vietnam 2019

venue.name: RMIT University Vietnam, Saigon South campus

events.description:
ğŸ”µ Droidcon is the largest global network of developer conferences which bring together the industry's foremost experts dedicated to advancing the Android platform.

ğŸ”µDroidcon is the place to meet the international Android community, learn from expert speakers and dive into the latest Android advances and explore cutting edge technologies, and it will be coming back to Vietnam again in 13th July, 2019.

ğŸ”µThe 2019 edition of droidcon in Vietnam will bring together android for everyone to celebrate the very best projects through the conference with more 16 professionals from inside or outside Vietnam .

- ENRIQUE LÃ“PEZ MANAS @Google Developer Expert, Germany
- YACINE REZGUI @Developer Advocate @Google and creator at Hania Labs
- SEBASTIAN SCHMIDT @Engineer on Firebase's San Francisco
- HIEU ROCKER @Google Developer Expert, Vietnam
- HOI LAM @Head of Developer Relations for Android Machine Learning
- JAMES DANIELS @Developer Relations at Google & Firebase
- BRITT BARAK @DevRel at Nexmo and Women Techmakers Israel community lead.
- HUYNH QUANG THAO @Google Developer Expert, Vietnam
- 8+ speakers

We will announce the topics soon and we welcome everyone interested to join.
------------------
ğŸŒWebsite: https://droidconvn.com
ğŸ”The information: https://www.facebook.com/droidcon.vn/
â© Register here: https://bitly.vn/2ftx
ğŸ• Time: 8:00 - 17:00 | Saturday - 13/07/2019
ğŸ“Address: Rmit University - 702 Nguyen Van Linh street, ward Tan Hung, District 7, HCMC

events.name: Transferable Skills in Tech + IamRemarkable (Everyone is welcome)
events.description:
*IMPORTANT* Please bring your government issued ID to enter the venue.
Arrive at least 15 minutes before the event start. Doors closes once event starts.

***RSPV required, please sign up using this Link***
https://www.womenmeettech.org/event-info/wmt-1-transferable-skills-and-iamremarkable

For more info, please visit https://www.facebook.com/events/374509829931546/

[Summary of content]
Beginners! Join us to know about how our tech advocates pick up their career in tech from different backgrounds and you can find your answers too.
#IamRemarkable, a Google initiative to empower women

[Program Agenda]
5:00-5:15 Introduction
5:15-6:00 Guest speakers present their tips on Transferable Skills in Tech
6:00-6:20 Q&A
6:20-7:00 #IamRemarkable

[Guest speakers]
Mark Evans - Frontend Developer NFQ Asia, former National Service Manager Wall Street English Vietnam & Korea
Quynh Ruby - Software Engineer EGANY
Tham Le - Sr Software Engineer Chotot

Host - Lea Truc - Google Women Techmaker Ambassador, former college faculty in Boston, MA.

events.name: Web Tech basics + Diversity CrowdPitch
events.description:
*PLEASE BRING YOUR LAPTOP
*Since the event will be hosted at the US. Consulate HCMC, please bring your Government Issue ID to enter the venue. Without ID, access will be denied. Thank you for your understanding!
*Children under 15 are not permitted to enter the venue.

*RSVP here: http://bit.ly/2JxH3Tx

---------------------

'What I cannot create, I do not understand.' - Richard P. Feynman
Web technology is all around us and is a part of our modern life. How to understand it at the core? How to create something meaningful that you can share to the world?

Join us for our mini-bootcamp where you will learn about the most updated web technologies. For Beginners!!!

*For non-coding professionals to learn about web application basics, pitching for diversity and inclusion. No-coding experience required.

ğŸ”¥Code, get support, and win small prize in the very first Diversity Crowdpitch in Vietnam ğŸ”¥

EVERYONE IS WELCOME TO JOIN! ğŸ™‹â€â™‚ï¸ğŸ™‹â€â™€ï¸ğŸ™†â€â™€ï¸ğŸ™†â€â™‚ï¸

-----------------------
SPEAKERS
- Lea Truc - Google Women Techmaker Ambassador, lead Women Meet Tech.
- Tham Le - Sr Software Engineer Chotot
- Quynh Ruby - Software Engineer Egany, admin at Bi Kip Lam Web

SECTION 1 (1:30 - 4:45 PM)
- Web Tech basics Lecture
- Pitch deck preparation: how to deliver a great pitch
- Form teams and Hands-on coding (with support from Women Meet Tech team)

SECTION 2 (05:00 - 6:00 PM)
- Diversity CrowdPitch: Best team present project pitches
- 10' Break
- Result Announcement and Certificate
events.how_to_find_us: 8 Floor, Diamond Plaza, Le Duan st. Please remember to bring your ID / Passport to check in to the American Center

organizers.name: George N.
organizers.bio: George is an experience Senior Manager across different industries including IT, FMCG, Logistic & Education. He's currently Country Manager of 2359 Media, visiting lecturer of RMIT University & an entrepreneur who is opened for investment invitation.

organizers.name: Ngan
organizers.bio: Hi, I am Ngan learning how to be entrepreneur and write about local tech news in Vietnam on Twenty.vn. I love traveling and learning entrepreneurship from everyone around me.

group_profile.intro: I'm community builder in Vietnam, love tech startup & geeks world.

organizers.name: Lea T.
organizers.bio: Founder/ Coding Instructor of {Cat Can Code}. Lea Truc has led multiple community events and seminars with TEDx Saigon, Google Developer Group Vietnam and more about tech & women empowerment. Google DEVFEST VIETNAM 2018 and IWD 2019: Women Meet Code.
